title: Princeton achieves 10x reduction in tritium needs for nuclear fusion
excerpt: US scientists made a breakthrough in fusion energy, discovering a new fuel mix that could improve efficiency and reduce tritium reliance.

title: Nuclear Fusion’s New Idea: An Off-the-Shelf Stellarator
excerpt: Fast prototyping revives a 70-year-old reactor design

title: Marvel Fusion breaks ground on $150M laser facility in Colorado
excerpt: The ATLAS facility will use three ultra-high intensity lasers to initiate the same reaction that powers the Sun and stars.

title: Will We Ever Get Fusion Power?
excerpt: “Every one of the stars in the sky uses fusion to generate enormous amounts of energy. Why shouldn’t we?”

title: The Quest for Fusion Energy
excerpt: Despite repeated claims that the prospects for commercialization have never looked brighter, the stark reality is that practical fusion-based electric power remains a very distant prospect.
